item.title: 日本国债崩盘引发全球市场7万亿美元风险
item.description:
随着日本朝着首相高市早苗宣布的提前大选加速前进，预计将出现更多难以预测且剧烈的价格波动。【原文：

As the country hurtles towards the snap election called by Prime Minister Takaichi, more unpredictable and violent price swings are expected

】

item.title: 日元延续涨势 干预威胁持续发酵：市场综述
item.description: 日元兑美元汇率延续涨势，市场对日本政府可能出手干预以遏制日元近期跌势的担忧情绪升温。【原文：The yen extended its advance against the dollar amid heightened alert of Japanese intervention to halt the currency’s recent slide.】

item.title: 中国国家队680亿美元撤资改变股市策略
item.description: 多年来，中国股市投资者始终受益于一道无形的后盾：所谓的"国家队"悄然部署庞大资金，在市场抛售时提供缓冲，稳定股价。【原文：For years, investors in China’s stock market took comfort in an unseen backstop: the so-called national team, quietly deploying vast firepower to cushion selloffs and stabilize prices.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚左翼候选人塞佩达在新总统民调中领先
item.description: 根据周日公布的一项民调，哥伦比亚左翼候选人伊万·塞佩达在五月总统大选中领先选民支持率，巩固了其主要竞争者的地位。【原文：Colombian leftist candidate Iván Cepeda led voters’ preferences for May’s presidential election according to a poll published on Sunday, consolidating his status as a main contender.】

item.title: 加拿大不会在贸易转向问题上退缩，能源部长即将出访印度
item.description: 加拿大外交部长阿尼塔·阿南德表示，尽管特朗普政府最近发出威胁，但加拿大不会在努力实现贸易多元化、减少对美国的依赖方面偏离轨道。【原文：Canada won’t be derailed in its efforts to diversify trade away from the US despite the latest threats from the Trump administration, Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand said.】

item.title: 贝森特认为加拿大央行行长卡尼对华贸易政策将"急转直下"
item.description: 财政部长斯科特·贝森特指出，总理马克·卡尼与中国达成降低部分贸易壁垒的协议，此举堪称"急转弯"，进一步强化了特朗普总统对加拿大最新关税威胁的立场。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent suggested that Prime Minister Mark Carney did an “about-face” by striking a deal with China to lower some trade barriers, reinforcing President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threat against Canada.】

item.title: 波兰经济无需欧元照样强劲，部长向《金融时报》表示
item.description: 波兰财政部长安杰伊·多马斯基向《金融时报》表示，波兰经济增速超过欧元区国家，这进一步印证了该国应保持在单一货币区之外的观点。【原文：Poland’s economy is expanding faster than its peers in the euro region, reinforcing arguments that the country should remain outside the single currency zone, Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski told the Financial Times.】

item.title: 大众汽车首席执行官称若关税不降或取消美国奥迪工厂计划
item.description: 大众汽车集团首席执行官奥利弗·布鲁姆向德国《商报》表示，除非降低汽车关税，否则大众不会推进在美国建设奥迪工厂的计划。【原文：Volkswagen AG won’t go ahead with a planned Audi factory in the US unless automotive tariffs are reduced, Chief Executive Officer Oliver Blume told Germany’s Handelsblatt newspaper.】

item.title: 投资者对冲中国与科技风险 特朗普TACO贸易戏码上演
item.description: 尽管美国总统唐纳德·特朗普对格陵兰岛的关税威胁主导了上周全球股市的走势，但投资者仍在其他领域进行风险对冲。【原文：While US President Donald Trump’s tariff threats over Greenland dominated the narrative for broader equity markets last week, investors were hedging risks elsewhere.】

item.title: 电力交易初创企业Enechain获3200万美元融资用于业务扩张
item.description: 知情人士透露，日本新兴电力市场初创企业Enechain已筹集50.5亿日元（约合3190万美元）资金用于业务扩张。【原文：Enechain, a startup in Japan’s growing power market, raised 5.05 billion yen ($31.9 million) to expand its business, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 智利候任财政部长豪尔赫·基罗斯提出更渐进的支出削减方案
item.description: 智利候任财政部长豪尔赫·基罗斯表示，随着经济增长回升，60亿美元的公共开支削减可能需要比总统竞选期间承诺的18个月更长时间才能实现。【原文：Chile’s incoming Finance Minister Jorge Quiroz indicated that $6 billion in public spending cuts could transpire over a longer period than the 18 months pledged during the presidential campaign, as growth picks up.】

item.title: 科技巨头财报出炉，2026年AI赢家仍存变数
item.description: 投资者近期通过聚焦人工智能领域的利基股赚得盆满钵满。本周全球多家科技巨头的财报将为他们提供指引，决定2026年是否应继续坚持这一策略。【原文：Investors have made a pile of money recently by focusing on niche stocks in the AI trade. Earnings from some of the world’s biggest technology companies this week will offer an indication of whether they should stick to that strategy in 2026.】

item.title: 沙特开发商跃跃欲试，王国正推动房地产市场开放
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯开发商股价创四个月来最大涨幅，因该国开始实施新法规，允许外国人持有更多类型的本土房地产资产，包括麦加和麦地那两座圣城内的房产。【原文：Saudi Arabian developers’ shares jumped the most in four months as the kingdom began implementing new laws allowing foreigners to own a wider range of local real estate assets, including in the holy cities of Mecca and Madinah.】

item.title: 维托尔与托克：特朗普夺取委内瑞拉石油的核心贸易商
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统将接管委内瑞拉石油销售描绘成美国的胜利，但当其政府急于出售价值数十亿美元的燃料时，所寻求的专家竟是两家外国贸易公司。【原文：President Donald Trump has portrayed his takeover of Venezuela’s oil sales as a victory for America, but when his administration wanted to sell several billion dollars’ worth of the fuel quickly, the experts it turned to were a couple of foreign trading houses.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚考虑核电提案以避免停电，武契奇表示
item.description: 塞尔维亚总统亚历山大·武契奇表示，该国将加快首座核电站的筹建工作，以应对电力需求激增的局面，同时正着手淘汰老旧的燃煤发电机组。【原文：Serbia will speed up preparations for its first nuclear power plants as it faces a surge in consumption even while attempting to phase out outdated, thermal-power units, said President Aleksandar Vucic.】

item.title: 苹果人工智能大调整内幕及其推出两款新版Siri的计划
item.description: 苹果通过与谷歌合作、管理层变动及推出两款新版Siri，重振其人工智能业务。此外：该公司正筹备启动2026年Mac新品发布，并任命首席执行官候选人约翰·特纳斯负责设计事务。【原文：Apple shakes up its AI efforts with a Google partnership, management changes and two new versions of Siri. Also: The company gets ready to kick off its 2026 Mac launches and puts CEO candidate John Ternus in charge of design.】

item.title: 新兴亚洲吸引资本涌入，地缘政治动荡刺激风险偏好
item.description: 新兴亚洲正作为相对避风港吸引新需求，尽管部分短期风险有所缓解，但该地区仍能抵御其他地区的地缘政治不确定性。【原文：Emerging Asia is drawing fresh demand as a relative refuge from geopolitical uncertainty elsewhere, even as some immediate risks ease.】

item.title: 黑海泊位恢复后，哈萨克斯坦石油运输将恢复正常
item.description: 里海输油管道联合公司表示，一处海上系泊装置已恢复运行，使原油能够通过这条承担哈萨克斯坦约90%石油出口的路线输送。【原文：The Caspian Pipeline Consortium said an offshore mooring is back online, enabling crude to flow through a route that accounts for about 90% of Kazakh oil exports.】

item.title: 高桥一志警告后市场对日元干预保持高度警惕
item.description: 交易员本周将高度警惕日本政府可能采取干预措施阻止日元近期跌势——或将获得美国罕见协助——此前首相高市早苗已警告将对异常波动采取行动。【原文：Traders will start the week on heightened alert of Japan government intervention to halt the yen’s recent slide — possibly with rare US assistance — as Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi warned of action on abnormal moves.】

item.title: Netflix高风险摩天大楼攀爬行动在延迟24小时后启动
item.description: 网飞公司启动了迄今为止最具野心的直播活动之一，通过网络直播美国自由攀岩者亚历克斯·洪诺尔德攀登台北101大楼的过程——此前因雨延迟了24小时。【原文：Netflix Inc. kicked off one of its most ambitious live events yet, streaming US free-solo climber Alex Honnold as he began scaling Taipei 101 after a 24-hour delay caused by rain.】

item.title: 诉讼指控Meta可查看WhatsApp聊天记录，涉嫌侵犯隐私
item.description: 一个国际原告团体起诉Meta Platforms公司，指控该公司对其WhatsApp聊天服务的隐私和安全性做出了虚假声明。【原文：An international group of plaintiffs sued Meta Platforms, Inc. alleging that the company has made false claims about the privacy and security of its WhatsApp chat service.】

item.title: 卡尼将于三月访澳，"中等强国"展开互动
item.description: 加拿大总理马克·卡尼将于三月访问澳大利亚。在美方及其他强权集团施压之际，这个南太平洋国家正持续与所谓中等强国开展接触。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney will visit Australia in March as the South Pacific nation continues to engage with so-called middle powers amid pressure from the US and other powerful blocs.】

item.title: 美国冬季风暴引发电网紧急状态，交通陷入混乱
item.description: 一场席卷全美的冬季风暴已导致全美范围内超过14,500个航班取消，列车停运，并引发电网紧急状态，导致数千户家庭断电。与此同时，这场风暴还威胁着要在周日给纽约市及东北走廊其他地区带来约30厘米的降雪。【原文：A sprawling winter storm has grounded more than 14,500 flights around the US, halted trains and triggered a grid emergency and knocked out power to thousands, all while threatening to drop a foot of snow on New York City and the rest of the Northeast corridor on Sunday.】

item.title: 明尼阿波利斯市最新枪击案后 民主党人威胁政府停摆
item.description: 参议院民主党领袖查克·舒默誓言，除非共和党取消对国土安全部的拨款，否则下周将阻止一项大规模支出计划，这大大增加了美国政府部分停摆的风险。【原文：Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer vowed to block a massive spending package next week unless Republicans strip funding for the Department of Homeland Security, dramatically increasing the risk for a partial US government shutdown.】

item.title: 双重经济格局重塑中国股市格局
item.description: 中国股市正呈现双重经济格局，投资者纷纷押注工业出口热潮的受益者，而深陷消费低迷的企业则遭受冷遇。【原文：A tale of two economies is driving China’s stock market, prompting investors to raise bets on the beneficiaries of an industrial export boom at the expense of firms mired in a consumption slump.】

item.title: 特朗普最新对加威胁预示美墨加协定谈判将充满波折
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统最新提出的关税威胁，可能预示着美加墨三国今年将重新审议贸易协定之际，这场预计将持续数月的动荡博弈或将提前升级。【原文：President Donald Trump’s latest tariff threats may signal an early escalation in what’s expected to be months of volatile posturing as the US, Canada and Mexico prepare to review their trade pact this year.】

item.title: 美国将向美国稀土公司投资16亿美元：《金融时报》报道
item.description: 《金融时报》援引知情人士消息报道称，特朗普政府计划向美国稀土公司投资16亿美元。【原文：The Trump administration is planning to invest $1.6 billion into USA Rare Earth, the Financial Times reported, citing unidentified people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日本经济大臣高市早苗警告称，将对投机性市场行为采取行动
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗在债券收益率上升、日元走弱之际，再次对金融市场发出警告，表示政府将随时准备采取行动。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi issued a fresh warning against the financial markets amid rising bond yields and the weakening yen, saying the government will be ready to take action.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，料将引领全球央行维持利率不变
item.description: 美联储及其三位刚表态支持其备受争议的主席的央行行长，正准备在全球政策制定者面临关键时刻之际维持利率不变。【原文：The Federal Reserve and three of the central banks that just backed its embattled chair are poised to keep interest rates unchanged at an edgy moment for global policymakers.】

item.title: 今年垃圾债券需求激增：信用周刊
item.description: 今年前几周表现最佳的美国债券恰恰是评级最低的债券，这表明企业违约风险目前在投资者担忧清单中排名靠后。【原文：Some of the best performing US debt in the first weeks of this year is the lowest rated, implying that corporate defaults are low on the list of investor fears now.】
